selected_quotes: What we do to the #Ocean we do to ourselves. Example: #PlasticPollution is showing up in #beer. #banthebag
Reinheitsgebot? Study: 24 German beers analysed for #microplastics contaminated
Not even beer is safe from #microplastics as study finds traces in 24 German beer brands :(
Not even beer is safe from #microplastics as study finds traces in 24 German beer brands :( @BeatTheBead
Bad news. Scientists tested 24 German beers found all contained bits of plastic. Oddly, analcoholic beers had less

citation.abstract: A total of 24 German beer brands was analysed for the contents of microplastic fibres, fragments and granular material. In all cases contamination was found. Counts ranged from 2 to 79 fibres L(-1), from 12 to 109 fragments L(-1) and from 2 to 66 granules L(-1). The results show a high variability between individual samples and samples from different production dates. Possible sources of this contamination with foreign materials are discussed.
citation.title: Synthetic particles as contaminants in German beers.

news.title: Planning a visit to Germany? You might want to avoid the beer…
news.summary: If you’re going to Oktoberfest next month to enjoy the delights of German beer, you might get more than you bargained for. New research has revealed the extent to which German beers may be contaminated by foreign substances, most notably, microplastics.

news.title: Lebensmittelhygiene: Verunreinigt Plastik unser Bier?
news.summary: Warnhinweis: Deutsches Bier kann Spuren von Plastik enthalten. Und, selten einmal, auch ein Insekt. Insgesamt sind wir aber wohl kaum gefährdet.

news.title: German Beers Found to Contain Specks of Plastic, Dead Bugs, More
news.summary: A new study may kill all your future beer cravings. In a blow to the lofty reputation of German beer, a new study acquired by Modern Farmer reveals that 24 of Germany's "most popular beers" are all contaminated with little pieces of plastic , called microp

news.title: World's oceans choking on plastic waste
news.summary: Plastic is ubiquitous today, found in many consumer items. But once these products are thrown away, they often end up in the world's oceans, where they make their way through the ecosystem and - perhaps - back to us.

news.title: Surprise Finding Heightens Concern Over Tiny Bits Of Plastic Polluting Our Oceans
news.summary: Scientists are looking for -- and finding -- little bits of plastic in a lot of places lately: ice cores , deep sea sediments , coral reefs , crab gills , the digestive system of mussels , even German beer . Now, new research suggests they need not actuall

news.title: Bier-Fakten: Von Geschichte bis Gesundheit - fünf Fragen rund ums Bier
news.summary: Seit wann gibt es Bier? Die ältesten bekannten Anzeichen für so etwas Ähnliches wie Bier sind etwa 9000 Jahre alt und stammen aus China.

news.title: Plastic fibres found in tap water around the world, study reveals
news.summary: Microplastic contamination has been found in tap water in countries around the world, leading to calls from scientists for urgent research on the implications for health.

news.title: We are living on a plastic planet. What does it mean for our health?
news.summary: Sometimes a single revelation opens our eyes to a whole new view of the world. The contamination of tap water around the world with microplastics, exposed on Wednesday in the Guardian, unmasks Earth as a planet pervasively polluted with plastic.

news.title: Plastic fibres found in tap water around the world, study reveals

news.title: You’re probably drinking little bits of plastic in your tap water

news.title: National park ban saved 2m plastic bottles – and still Trump reversed it
news.summary: A ban on bottled water in 23 national parks prevented up to 2m plastic bottles from being used and discarded every year, a US national park service study found.

news.title: Nestlé pays $200 a year to bottle water near Flint – where water is undrinkable
news.summary: Gina Luster bathed her child in lukewarm bottled water, emptied bottle by bottle into the tub, for months.

news.title: Nestlé Pays $200 a Year to Bottle Water Near Flint – Where Water Is Undrinkable
news.summary: While Flint battles a water crisis, just two hours away the beverage giant pumps almost 100,000 times what an average Michigan resident uses into plastic bottles.

source.name: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations
source.description: The Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) of the United Nations is an intergovernmental organization whose mission is to achieve food security, ensuring that people have regular access to enough high-quality food to lead active, healthy lives.
